quest.name: Sense of Urgency
journal: An undisciplined unit is a unit ripe for destruction, as Ser Marielle knows.

The men and women of Camp Cloudtop have grown complacent, Ser Marielle says, as the camp has developed a reputation as a backwater of no significance in the war with Dravania. The knight cannot abide this state of affairs, and has asked you to stoke the fighting spirits of her sentries─/psych them up, in her own words.
Your wild gesticulations elicit a variety of responses from the sentries, one of whom is Lord Emmanellain. Ser Marielle will doubtless find the young lord's reaction the most interesting of all.

According to Ser Marielle, there has been a noticeable change in the sentries' behavior, which she ascribes to your efforts. But when you tell her of Lord Emmanellain's sudden desire for more demanding work, she can only chuckle nervously at the thought of what is to come.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Excepting your recent clashes with the Vanu, it cannot have escaped your notice that things here are rather peaceful─to the detriment of our garrison's discipline.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Despite being built as an observation post, we have yet to record a single intrusion by the Horde. That is why, as far as everyone is concerned, Camp Cloudtop is a backwater of no significance.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: And of course, the pride of our camp, the vaunted Protector, is in a perpetual state of needing repairs, so even were the Holy See to come under Dravanian attack, we would be unable to fly to their aid.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Simply put, MistressMaster Surname, this is where ambition comes to die. If you haven't aspirations for advancement, you'll be right at home.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: However, I would like to think that enthusiasm can be just as contagious as apathy. If you'll indulge me, I would have you seek out the sentries and stoke their fighting spirit─psych them up, you might say.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Try to psych them up, as you might say. That should serve to liven their spirits.

dialogue.name: KIGHTA01593
dialogue.text:
Wh-What!? What is it!? Is it the Horde!?
...By the Fury, what ever possessed you to do that?

dialogue.name: KIGHTA01593
dialogue.text: I'm awake, I'm awake, worry not. After the shock you just gave me, I doubt I'll sleep for a fortnight!

dialogue.name: KIGHTA01593
dialogue.text: Mmm... Is there anything fluffier than a cloud...?

dialogue.name: KIGHTA01593
dialogue.text: Mmm... If there is, I don't want to know about it...

dialogue.name: KIGHTB01593
dialogue.text: Ye gods, where did that come from?

dialogue.name: KIGHTB01593
dialogue.text: Fine, if you insist, I will make an effort to be more alert. But really, I fail to see the point! We're hundreds of malms away from the front lines─which is just the way I like it, thank you very much!

dialogue.name: KIGHTB01593
dialogue.text: You're looking rather grim. Why so serious? The Vanu are no real threat, and the Dravanians couldn't give a fig about us.

dialogue.name: KIGHTB01593
dialogue.text: ...Aren't you an odd lassfellow. Don't you have somewhere to be?

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: I-Is it an attack!? What should we do!? What should we do!?

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: ...You had me fooled there for a moment, old girlboy! An amusing jest─albeit a tad cruel. Surely you must realize how unsuited I am to the monotony of mere sentry duty─yet still you tempt me with the promise of excitement!

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: No, this won't do. This won't do at all. Lady Laniaitte will give me a grand mission as befits my station!

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: <yawn> Hello there, old girlboy. Slain any Vanu champions yet? No? Oh, well, let me know when you have so I can make myself presentable for...for the... <snore>

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Is this what you do for fun? Or is it some esoteric form of training? Well then, carry on, carry on.

dialogue.name: HONOROIT
dialogue.text: As you wish, my lord. Should I spy an outflyer, I will alert you immediately...

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Many thanks, MistressMaster Surname. Already I can see a change in our sentries' behavior.

dialogue.name: MARIELLE
dialogue.text: Beg your pardon... Lord Emmanellain said what? Hah, well... I have no doubt that Lady Laniaitte will do her utmost to oblige him.
